page.title: 11THE WOODCARVER AT DRAYCOTT
page.content: WE WENT TO SEE THE {DRAYCOTT {WOODCARVER}. THE WOOD HE USES IS MOSTLY {BEECH}AND {OAK.}FIRST WE WENT ROUND THE MACHINERY WHERE HE PREPARED THE WOOD AND SAW SOME BEING MADE SMOOTH. DUST IS DANGEROUS SO HE WEARS A MINER'S FACE MASK AND EARMUFFS BECAUSE OF THE NOISE. WE WENT UPSTAIRS TO THE SHOWROOM. HE HAD A CARVED FOUR POSTER BED AND A COFFEE TABLE WITH A KNIGHT CARVED INTO IT. THERE WERE BUTTER PATS AND SPICE RACKS AND EGG RACKS. ON THE BED AND ALL THE OTHER THINGS HE PUT HIS {EMBLEM} OF A { {DOLPHIN}AND SOMETIMES HIS INITIALS AND THE DATE. HE HAS BEEN A WOODCARVER FOR 16 YEARS AND HIS WORK GOES ALL OVER THE WORLD.
